goal_description: Predict the set of bird species calling in each time window of the soundscape recordings.

train.data_description: Short mp3 recordings of individual bird calls from xeno-canto.org, accompanied by train.csv metadata (ebird_code, recodist, location, date, filename, etc.).

test.data_description: Approximately 150 long (≈10‑minute) mp3 recordings from three remote sites. test.csv provides row identifiers, site IDs, seconds (5‑second windows for sites 1 & 2, file‑level for site 3) and audio_id.

output_format: CSV with header row_id,birds. For each row_id output a space‑separated list of unique ebird codes present in that time window, or the token "nocall" if no bird call is detected.
special_instructions:
1. Provide predictions for every row_id in test.csv.
2. Use space‑separated ebird codes (e.g., "amecro amerob").
3. If no bird call is present in the window, output "nocall".
4. Sites 1 and 2 require 5‑second resolution predictions; site 3 predictions are at the whole‑file level (seconds field may be null).
5. Follow the exact submission format shown in the task description, including the header.
